intro: Aconogonon kuttiense, commonly known as the Kuttanad morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Kerala, India. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces tendrils that help it climb and spread across vegetation. It thrives in moist, tropical climates and is often found near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine.
